name: src/Client.js

params.name: provider
params.description: Data source/provider for the instance

params.name: version
params.description: Minimum blockchain node version to support

params.name: provider
params.description: The provider instance or RPC connection string

return.description: Returns instance of Client

throws.description: When same provider is added again

name: getProviderForMethod
description: Check the availability of a method.

params.name: method
params.description: Name of the method to look for in the provider stack

params.name: requestor
params.description:
If provided, it returns providers only
 above the requestor in the stack.

return.description: Returns a provider instance associated with the requested method

throws.description: When no provider is available in the stack.

When the requested method is not provided
 by any provider above requestor in the provider stack

When requested method is not supported by
 version specified

params.name: numberOfBlocks
params.description: Number of blocks to be generated

return.description:
Resolves
 with Block hash of the generated blocks.
 Rejects with TypeError if input is invalid.
 Rejects with InvalidProviderResponseError if provider's response is invalid.

name: getBlockByHash
description: Get a block given its hash.

params.name: blockHash
params.description:
A hexadecimal string that represents the
 *hash* of the desired block.

params.name: includeTx
params.description: If true, fetches transaction in the block.

return.description:
Resolves with a Block with the same hash as the given input.
 If `includeTx` is true, the transaction property is an array of Transactions;
 otherwise, it is a list of transaction hashes.
 Rejects with TypeError if input is invalid.
 Rejects with InvalidProviderResponseError if provider's response is invalid.

name: getBlockByNumber
description: Get a block given its number.

params.name: blockNumber
params.description: The number of the desired block.

params.name: includeTx
params.description: If true, fetches transaction in the block.

return.description:
Resolves with a Block with the same number as the given input.
 If `includeTx` is true, the transaction property is an array of Transactions;
 otherwise, it is a list of transaction hashes.
 Rejects with TypeError if input is invalid.
 Rejects with InvalidProviderResponseError if provider's response is invalid.

name: getBlockHeight
description: Get current block height of the chain.

return.description:
Resolves with
 chain height.
 Rejects with InvalidProviderResponseError if provider's response is invalid.

name: getTransactionByHash
description: Get a transaction given its hash.

params.name: txHash
params.description:
A hexadecimal string that represents the *hash* of the
 desired transaction.

return.description:
Resolves with a Transaction with the same hash as the given input.
 Rejects with TypeError if input is invalid.
 Rejects with InvalidProviderResponseError if provider's response is invalid.

name: getRawTransactionByHash
description: Get a raw hexadecimal transaction given its hash.

params.name: txHash
params.description:
A hexadecimal string that represents the *hash* of the
 desired transaction.

return.description:
Resolves with the raw Transaction with
 the same hash as the given output.
 Rejects with TypeError if input is invalid.
 Rejects with InvalidProviderResponseError if provider's response is invalid.

Resolves with a list
 of accounts.
 Rejects with InvalidProviderResponseError if provider's response is invalid.

params.name: message
params.description: Message to be signed.

params.name: from
params.description: The address from which the message is signed.

return.description: Resolves with a signed message.

name: sendTransaction
description: Send a transaction to the chain

params.name: from
params.description: The address identifier for the sender.

params.name: to
params.description: The address identifier for the receiver.

params.name: value
params.description:
Number representing the amount associated with.
 the transaction.

params.name: data
params.description: Optional data to send with the transaction.

return.description:
Resolves with an identifier for
 the broadcasted transaction.
 Rejects with InvalidProviderResponseError if provider's response is invalid.

name: sendRawTransaction
description: Broadcast a transaction to the network using it's raw seriealized transaction.

params.name: rawTransaction
params.description:
A raw transaction usually in the form of a
 hexadecimal string that represents the serialized transaction.

return.description:
Resolves with an
 identifier for the broadcasted transaction.
 Rejects with InvalidProviderResponseError if provider's response is invalid.

params.name: message
params.description: Message to be used for generating secret.

return.description: Resolves with a secret.

params.name: recipientAddress
params.description: Recepient address for the swap in hex.

params.name: refundAddress
params.description: Refund address for the swap in hex.

params.name: secretHash
params.description: Secret hash for the swap in hex.

params.name: expiration
params.description: Expiration time for the swap.

return.description:
Resolves with swap contract bytecode.
 Rejects with InvalidProviderResponseError if provider's response is invalid.

Secure driver connection postfix and checker
Ref - https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc3986#section-3.1

setClient
description: Set client to a provider instance.

params.name: client
params.description: The ChainAbstractionLayer instance

params.name: method
params.description: Name of the method

return.description:
Returns a method from a provider above current Provider
 in the stack.

name: src/crypto.js
hashToHex
description: Get hash of a message in hex.

params.name: algorithm
params.description: Hashing algorithm.

params.name: message
params.description: Message to be hashed.

return.description: Returns the hash of a string.

params.name: message
params.description: message in string or Buffer.

return.description: Returns the sha256 of a string.

params.name: message
params.description: message in string or Buffer.

return.description: Returns the ripemd160 of a string.

params.name: message
params.description: message in string or Buffer.

return.description: Returns the hash160 of a string.

name: ensureBuffer
description: Ensure message is in buffer format.

params.name: message
params.description: any string.

return.description: Returns Buffer of string.

name: src/errors.js
src/index.js
content:
import Client from './Client'
import Provider from './Provider'
import networks from './networks'

import * as providers from './providers'
import * as crypto from './crypto'
import * as errors from './errors'
import * as schema from './schema'

export {
  Client,
  Provider,
  networks,
  providers,
  crypto,
  errors,
  schema
}

src/providers/JsonRpcProvider.js
src/providers/RpcError.js
src/providers/bitcoin/BitcoinLedgerProvider.js

params.name: testnet
params.description: True if the testnet network is being used

src/providers/bitcoin/BitcoinSwapProvider.js
src/providers/bitcoin/BitcoinUtil.js

params.name: pubKey
params.description: 65 byte string with prefix, x, y.

return.description: Returns the compressed pubKey of uncompressed pubKey.

params.name: pubKey
params.description: 65 byte uncompressed pubKey or 33 byte compressed pubKey.

params.name: network
params.description: bitcoin, testnet, or litecoin.

params.name: type
params.description: pubKeyHash or scriptHash.

return.description: Returns the address of pubKey.

params.name: pubKeyHash
params.description: hash160 of pubKey.

params.name: network
params.description: bitcoin, testnet, or litecoin.

params.name: type
params.description: pubKeyHash or scriptHash.

return.description: Returns the address derived from pubKeyHash.

params.name: address
params.description: bitcoin base58 encoded address.

return.description: Returns the pubKeyHash of bitcoin address.

src/schema/index.js

content:
# Chain Abstraction Layer [![ChainAbstractionLayer](https://travis-ci.org/consensys/chainabstractionlayer.svg?branch=master)](https://travis-ci.org/consensys/chainabstractionlayer) [![Standard Code Style](https://img.shields.io/badge/codestyle-standard-brightgreen.svg)](https://github.com/standard/standard) [![MIT License](https://img.shields.io/badge/license-MIT-brightgreen.svg)](./LICENSE.md) [![ChainAbstractionLayer](https://img.shields.io/npm/dt/chainabstractionlayer.svg)](https://npmjs.com/package/chainabstractionlayer) > :warning: This project is under heavy development. Expect bugs & breaking changes. Query different blockchains with a single and simple interface. ## Installation ```bash npm install chainabstractionlayer ``` ## Usage ```javascript import { Client, providers } from 'chainabstractionlayer' const { BitcoinRPCProvider } = providers.bitcoin const bitcoin = new Client() bitcoin.addProvider(new BitcoinRPCProvider('http://localhost:8080', 'bitcoin', 'local321')) bitcoin .generateBlock(1) // returns Promise .then(console.log) // Array ``` ### Try ChainAbstractionLayer in Browser
Chain Wallet Provider
Ethereum Ledger Source & Demo
MetaMask Source & Demo
Bitcoin Ledger Source & Demo
## Documentation The documentation is being generated by [esdoc](https://www.npmjs.com/package/esdoc). Github Page hosted documentation is available at [consensys.github.io/chainabstractionlayer](https://consensys.github.io/chainabstractionlayer/) If you want to build documentation locally; ```bash npm run build:docs ``` ## License [MIT](./LICENSE.md)
name: ./README.md

content:
{
  "name": "chainabstractionlayer",
  "version": "0.1.0",
  "keywords": [
    "blockchain",
    "bitcoin",
    "ethereum",
    "client",
    "abstraction",
    "rpc",
    "wallet",
    "ledger",
    "metamask"
  ],
  "license": "MIT",
  "repository": {
    "type": "git",
    "url": "git+ssh://git@github.com/consensys/chainabstractionlayer.git"
  },
  "bugs": {
    "url": "https://github.com/consensys/chainabstractionlayer/issues"
  },
  "homepage": "https://github.com/consensys/chainabstractionlayer#readme",
  "author": "Liquality <info@liquality.io>",
  "module": "src/index.js",
  "browser": {
    "@ledgerhq/hw-transport-node-hid": "@ledgerhq/hw-transport-u2f"
  },
  "main": "dist/index.cjs.js",
  "files": [
    "dist/index.umd.js",
    "src/**/*"
  ],
  "scripts": {
    "cover": "nyc --reporter=html --reporter=text npm test",
    "lint": "standard \"**/*.js\" \"**/*.html\" \"**/*.md\"",
    "test": "cross-env NODE_ENV=test mocha $npm_package_options_mocha",
    "build:dev:node": "webpack --config ./webpack/webpack.node.config.js",
    "build:dev:browser": "webpack --config ./webpack/webpack.browser.config.js",
    "build:dev": "webpack --config ./webpack/webpack.config.js",
    "build:node": "cross-env NODE_ENV=production BABEL_ENV=production npm run build:dev:node",
    "build:browser": "cross-env NODE_ENV=production BABEL_ENV=production npm run build:dev:browser",
    "build": "cross-env NODE_ENV=production BABEL_ENV=production npm run build:dev",
    "copy:browser-examples-to-docs": "copy \"examples/browser/**/*\" docs/examples/browser",
    "copy:browser-build-to-docs": "copy \"dist/index.umd.js\" docs/",
    "build:docs": "esdoc",
    "prepare:docs": "run-s build build:docs copy:*",
    "push:docs": "gh-pages -d docs/ -m \"Auto-generated commit for documentation\"",
    "publish:docs": "run-s prepare:docs push:docs"
  },
  "dependencies": {
    "@babel/runtime": "^7.0.0-beta.56",
    "@ledgerhq/hw-app-btc": "^4.20.0",
    "@ledgerhq/hw-app-eth": "^4.19.0",
    "@ledgerhq/hw-transport-node-hid": "~4.21.0",
    "@ledgerhq/hw-transport-u2f": "^4.20.0",
    "ajv": "^6.5.2",
    "axios": "^0.18.0",
    "bech32": "^1.1.3",
    "bs58": "^4.0.1",
    "crypto-hashing": "^1.0.0",
    "dsn-parser": "^1.0.1",
    "json-bigint": "^0.3.0",
    "lodash": "^4.0.0",
    "standard-error": "^1.1.0"
  },
  "devDependencies": {
    "@babel/core": "^7.0.0-beta.54",
    "@babel/plugin-transform-runtime": "^7.0.0-beta.56",
    "@babel/polyfill": "^7.0.0-beta.54",
    "@babel/preset-env": "^7.0.0-beta.54",
    "@babel/register": "^7.0.0-beta.54",
    "babel-loader": "^8.0.0-beta.4",
    "babel-plugin-istanbul": "^4.1.6",
    "babel-plugin-lodash": "^3.3.4",
    "browserify": "^16.2.2",
    "chai-as-promised": "^7.1.1",
    "copy": "^0.3.2",
    "cross-env": "^5.2.0",
    "esdoc": "^1.1.0",
    "esdoc-ecmascript-proposal-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "esdoc-standard-plugin": "^1.0.0",
    "eslint-plugin-html": "^4.0.5",
    "eslint-plugin-markdown": "^1.0.0-beta.6",
    "gh-pages": "^1.2.0",
    "lodash-webpack-plugin": "^0.11.5",
    "mocha": "^5.2.0",
    "nock": "^9.3.0",
    "npm-run-all": "^4.1.3",
    "nyc": "^12.0.2",
    "pre-commit": "^1.2.2",
    "should": "^13.2.1",
    "standard": "^11.0.1",
    "webpack": "^4.16.1",
    "webpack-bundle-analyzer": "^2.13.1",
    "webpack-cli": "^3.1.0"
  },
  "engines": {
    "node": ">=8"
  },
  "nyc": {
    "include": [
      "src/"
    ],
    "instrument": false,
    "report-dir": "./coverage",
    "sourceMap": false
  },
  "options": {
    "mocha": "--require @babel/register --require @babel/polyfill --timeout 20000 --recursive --require should"
  },
  "pre-commit": [
    "lint",
    "build",
    "test"
  ],
  "standard": {
    "plugins": [
      "html",
      "markdown"
    ],
    "ignore": [
      "dist/**",
      "docs/**"
    ]
  }
}
name: package.json
